summary: Email correspondence from defense attorney Bruce Barket to prosecutors regarding discovery requests in the case of Nicholas Tartaglione, who was housed with Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The email discusses requests for surveillance video, photographs, and investigative reports related to the July 22-23, 2019 incident involving Tartaglione and Epstein, and includes a prior email from prosecutors detailing their responses to those requests.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, sending an email requesting additional discovery materials related to the July 22-23 incident involving Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, as evidenced by his correspondence seeking discovery on Tartaglione's behalf.
Were housed together in the same cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, involved in an incident on July 22-23, 2019.
Both are defense attorneys working together on the Tartaglione case, coordinating to review discovery materials.
Both are prosecutors with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, jointly responding to defense discovery requests.

events.title: Epstein-Tartaglione Cell Incident
events.description: Incident involving Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione in their SHU cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Scheduled Conference
events.description: Upcoming conference mentioned in the prosecutor's email, for which the BOP investigative report could be made available in advance.

locations: Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
White Plains office (of the U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The defense was seeking video surveillance of the area outside the cells for the night of July 22-23, 2019, and photographs of the Tartaglione/Epstein cell and the inmates following the incident.

Prosecutors stated that no audio/video recordings of BOP interviews of Tartaglione exist, no documentation exists regarding the decision to house Tartaglione and Epstein together, and no After Action Report was prepared for the July 22/23 incident.
A 53-page BOP investigative report related to the July 22/23 incident exists and was being made available for defense review under an 'Attorney's Eyes Only' protective order.
The correspondence reveals an ongoing investigation into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and the incident with his cellmate shortly before Epstein's death.
